issue.title: Accessing Nested Objects challenge could use a small change in instructions
issue.body: Based on [this forum thread discussion](w.freecodecamp.org/forum/t/accessing-nested-objects/136398/) and others like it, I am wondering if we should slightly modify the instructions for the [Accessing Nested Objects](https://learn.freecodecamp.org/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-javascript/accessing-nested-objects/) challenge.rnrnThe last test is written to only accept a solution were the properties 'car' and 'inside' must use dot notation and the 'glove box' property (of course) has to use bracket notation.  The instructions only state the camper to use bracket notation on the 'glove box', but does not make it clear bracket notation can not be used on 'car' and 'inside'.  Many campers don't understand why their solution (which would technically get the 'glove box' property's value) fails the last test.  With the current instructions, all three of the following should be accepted because the only real requirement in the current instructions is 'Use bracket notation for properties with a space in their name.'rnrn```rnvar gloveBoxContents = myStorage.car.inside['glove box'];rnvar gloveBoxContents = myStorage.car['inside']['glove box'];rnvar gloveBoxContents = myStorage['car'].inside['glove box'];rn```rnrnSince it is a 'best practice' for more readable code to use dot notation where possible, I am wondering what others think about changing the instructions to something like the following:rnrn> Access the `myStorage` object and assign the contents of the `glove box` property to the `gloveBoxContents` variable. Use dot notation for all properties where possible, otherwise use bracket notation.rnrnThis way the existing test can be used and the camper gets to use the knowledge they have already obtained from previous lessons (i.e. properties with spaces need bracket notation) without us explicitly telling them to use bracket notation (which felt a bit like hand-holding to me).rn

issue.title: Bug in 2nd test for Access Multi-Dimensional Arrays With Indexes challenge
issue.body: I see an issue related to the mal-formed 2nd test of this challenge at least once a day on the forum. An example is [this thread](https://www.freecodecamp.org/forum/t/bracket-notation-in-accessing-multi-dimensional-arrays-with-indexes/266940).rnrnAt some point, someone thought and second condition was needed in the assert statement to catch someone trying to solve the challenge by hard-coding the answer like:rn```jsrnvar myData = 8;rn```rnORrn```jsrnvar myData = 3 + 5;rn```rnrnIt could just be me, but there really is only one way to solve this challenge:rn```jsrnvar myData = myArray[2][1];rn```rnor some variation of the above with white space or leaving off the semi-colon.rnrnWhy would the following `testString` not suffice based on the test `text`? rn```ymlrnassert(/myData=myArray[2][1]/.test(code.replace(/s/g, ''));rn```rnrnI was also thinking maybe the `text` could be modified to the following, to make it even more clear:rn```ymlrn - text: You should only use bracket notation to read the correct value from myArray.rn```rnrnAt this point, I am looking for feedback. Once we decide the best course of action, I will add the `first timers welcome` label as it should literally be a copy/paste of the assert we come up with here.

issue.title: Remove reference to 'backspace' regex in example
issue.body: **Add a Link to the page with the problem:**rnrnOn this challenge: https://learn.freecodecamp.org/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-javascript/escape-sequences-in-strings/rnrnCurrently we use the word 'backspace' to describe the b expression. While this may be literally what it's called, it's unnecessarily confusing. b is generally used to indicate the 'boundary between words'.rnrnRather than teach people something so esoteric as to have [an entire Stack Overflow discussion](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17438100/whats-the-use-of-the-b-backspace-regex) about it, I recommend we just call it 'the boundary between words'.rnrnI recommend we update this sentence:rnrn'First is to allow you to use characters you might not otherwise be able to type out, such as a backspace. Second is to allow you to represent multiple quotes in a string without JavaScript misinterpreting what you mean.'rnrnI recommend we turn it into an ordered list for clarity and use carriage return as the example instead of backspace:rnrn1. To allow you to use characters you may not otherwise be able to type out, such as a carriage returns.rn2. To allow you to represent multiple quotes in a string without JavaScript misinterpreting what you mean.rnrnThen, instead of calling b 'backspace' in the table, I recommend we call it 'word boundary'

issue.title: Update text in Sort an Array Alphabetically using the sort Method Challenge
issue.body: <!-- rnNOTE: If you're reporting a security issue, don't create a GitHub issue. Instead, email security@freecodecamp.org. We will look into it immediately. rn-->rn**Describe your problem and how to reproduce it:**rnThis challenge has an example of sorting like this:rn```jsrnfunction reverseAlpha(arr) {rn  return arr.sort(function(a, b) {rn    return a < b;rn  });rn}rnreverseAlpha(['l', 'h', 'z', 'b', 's']);rn````rnThis example uses a bad compare function. In recent changes to Chrome the following example no longer properly sorts the array:rn```jsrnreverseAlpha(['l', 'h', 'z', 'b', 's']);rn/* outputrn['l', 'h', 'z', 'b', 's'] - in latest chrome 70rnand not rn['z', 's', 'l', 'h', 'b'] - this is shown in the examplern*/rn```rnThe compare function needs to return a number `1, 0 or -1` to be able to sort an array properly.rnrn#### Note: The previous example worked properly in Chrome <= 69 but due to recent changes it no longer works as intended.rnrn### Resolve:rnrnThis can be fixed by changing the compare function to return a number:rn```jsrnfunction reverseAlpha(arr) {rn  return arr.sort(function(a, b) {rn    return a < b ? 1 : -1;rn  });rn}rnreverseAlpha(['l', 'h', 'z', 'b', 's']); // u00a0['z', 's', 'l', 'h', 'b']rn```rn**Add a Link to the page with the problem:**rnhttps://learn.freecodecamp.org/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/functional-programming/sort-an-array-alphabetically-using-the-sort-method/rnrn**Tell us about your browser and operating system:**rn* Browser Name: Chromern* Browser Version: 70rn* Operating System: Windows 10rnrnrnrn

issue.title: Person first language - Accessibility
issue.body: <!-- NOTE: If you're reporting a security issue, don't create a GitHub issue. Instead, email security@freecodecamp.org. We will look into it immediately. -->rnrn#### Describe your problem and - if possible - how to reproduce itrnThis isn't really a coding issue.  This has to do with using 'person-first language' for the Applied Accessibility modules.  First, I want to say that I LOVELOVELOVE that you are teaching Applied Accessibility!  Thank you so much! I thought I was going to need to scour the web for good resources on building accessible sites.  Again, Thank You Thank You Thank You!!! rnrnIt's possible that you know all about this and just let it slip, but I noticed the 'Improve Accessibility of Audio Content with the audio Element' module has the sentence 'Audio content also needs a text alternative to be accessible to _the deaf or hard of hearing_.'  The only issue w/ this sentence is the use of 'the deaf...' as opposed to 'people who are deaf or hard of hearing.'  rnrnThis may seem inconsequential, but it's important to many people w/ disabilities b/c it puts an emphasis on the person being... well... a person.  Saying 'the deaf, the blind, or a paraplegic' is avoided because it reduces a person to their disability, whereas 'a person who is deaf, a person with visual impairments, or a person with paraplegia' puts an emphasis on humanity first and the disability second. rnrnIf you want any other tips on p.c. wording for accessibility, etc., that's my area!  Again, thanks so much for including this section!! rnrn#### Add a Link to the page with the problemrnrnrn#### Tell us about your browser and operating systemrnrn* Browser Name: rn* Browser Version: rn* Operating System: rnrnrn#### If possible, add a screenshot herernrnrn

issue.title: Contributing Guide- PR instructions inconsistency
issue.body: rn#### Issue DescriptionrnI just submitted a PR for the first time, following the instructions in the Contributing Guide, and noticed a couple of conflicting points:rnrn[link to the Contributing Guide 'Creating a PR' section](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md#common-steps)rnrn- under **Creating a PR**rn  - **method 1/point 8** instructs you to use the tool to create a commit, which automatically adds an issue number and description to the commit messagern- under **Common Steps**rn  - **point 4** says 'Do not add the issue number in the PR title or commit message.'rn  - **point 5** says 'at the end of your PR's description, append the keyword closes and #xxxx (where xxxx is the issue number)'rnrn**I guess the **Common Steps**/**point 4** part should be removed ?**rnrnrn

issue.title: Typo - CSS Grid: Limit Item Size Using the minmax Function
issue.body: #### Challenge Namern[CSS Grid: Limit Item Size using the minmax Function](https://beta.freecodecamp.org/en/challenges/css-grid/limit-item-size-using-the-minmax-function)rnrnrn#### Issue DescriptionrnFor the  challenge, the text states:rnrn> `grid-template-columns: 100px minmax(50px, 200px);`rn> rn> In the code above, grid-template-columns is set to create three columns; the first is 100px wide, and the second has the minimum width of 50px and the maximum width of 200px.rnrnThis may confuse people who are unfamiliar with the code. Instead, this should read:rnrn> In the code above, grid-template-columns is set to create **two** columns; the first is 100px wide, and the second has the minimum width of 50px and the maximum width of 200px.rnrn#### Screenshotrn![css-grid-screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32378788/38169715-5a7780d6-353f-11e8-8618-f3dcce741a5c.png)rnrnrnrn

issue.title: Add instructions on how to create your first user
issue.body: [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) currently describes how to set everything up, but leaves it up to the reader to understand that you will have to sign up locally, that the sign in link can be found in the console output or Mailhog and so forth.rnrnIt is not rocket science to figure it all out, but it would easier to get started if contributing documentation would show the whole flow.rnrnAny takers?rnrnrn

issue.title: Unused and confusing variable in challenge's code: Declare a Read-Only Variable with the const Keyword
issue.body: <!-- freeCodeCamp Issue Template -->rnrn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->rn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->rnrn<!-- NOTE: If your issue is CodePen Project / Test Suite related, please open it using the below URL instead -->rn<!-- https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/testable-projects-fcc/issues/new -->rnrn#### Challenge Namern<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->rn[ES6: Declare a Read-Only Variable with the const Keyword](https://beta.freecodecamp.org/en/challenges/es6/declare-a-readonly-variable-with-the-const-keyword)rnrn#### Issue Descriptionrn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->rnBased on the code, it seems that the intended result would be a message that adds the string ' is cool!' to the parameter string. However, to achieve that, we need to change `console.log(str);` to `console.log(sentence);`. Otherwise, there is no use for the constant `sentence` in this code and thus creates confusion.rnIn #16584 this line was changed from `console.log(str2);` .rnrnIt should also test for 'freeCodeCamp is cool!' to confirm that the user updated this line to all-caps as well.rnrnAdditionally, information in [the next challenge](https://beta.freecodecamp.org/en/challenges/es6/mutate-an-array-declared-with-const) may be important for campers to understand this one because at first it seems odd to declare `sentence` as a constant and then mutating it with changes in the `str` variable.

issue.title: Beta - CSS Grid - Challenge titles should be properly capitalized.
issue.body: #### Challenge Namern<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->rnAll CSS Grid Challengesrnrn#### Issue Descriptionrn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->rnThe titles of the challenges in CSS-Grid should be properly capitalized. rnrne.g. 'Add columns with grid-template-columns' should be changed to 'Add Columns with grid-gemplate-columns'rnrnNote: the CSS properties in the title should not be capitalized, and CSS should always be capitalized.rnrnThis is the file to that contains the CSS Grid challenges: rnhttps://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/seed/challenges/01-responsive-web-design/css-grid.jsonrnrnThe following is the title of the challenges that need changing:rnrn- Create your first CSS Gridrn- Add columns with grid-template-columnsrn- Add rows with grid-template-rowsrn- Use CSS Grid units to change the size of columns and rowsrn- Create a column gap using grid-column-gaprn- Create a row gap using grid-row-gaprn- Add gaps faster with grid-gaprn- Use grid-column to control spacingrn- Use grid-row to control spacingrn- Align an item horizontally using justify-selfrn- Align an item vertically using align-selfrn- Align all items horizontally using justify-itemsrn- Align all items vertically using align-itemsrn- Divide the grid into an area templatern- Place items in grid areas using the grid-area propertyrn- Use grid-area without creating an areas templatern- Reduce repetition using the repeat functionrn- Limit item size using the minmax functionrn- Create flexible layouts using auto-fillrn- Create flexible layouts using auto-fitrn- Use media queries to create responsive layoutsrn- Create grids within gridsrnrnHappy contributing.

issue.title: [Beta] Basic JavaScript - Mistake in example code
issue.body: #### ChallengernJavascript Algorithms And Data Structures - Basic JavaScript: Accessing Object Properties with Variablesrnhttps://beta.freecodecamp.org/en/challenges/basic-javascript/accessing-object-properties-with-variables rnrn#### Issue DescriptionrnThere's a minor mistake in the second example. rnThe example code saysrn```javascriptrnvar someObj = {rn  propName: 'John'rn};rnfunction propPrefix(str) {rn  var s = 'prop';rn  return s + str;rn}rnvar someProp = propPrefix('Name'); // someProp now holds the value 'propName'rnconsole.log(obj[someProp]); // 'John'rn```rn![fcc-basic-js-example-code](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10553848/36944086-b421958c-1fc7-11e8-9cdb-3abbf9f89f00.png)rnrnIf you tried to run the code, it wouldn't print 'John' in the console as variable _obj_ is not defined. rnI guess the last line was supposed to be rn```javascriptrnconsole.log(someObj[someProp]); // 'John'rn```rn

This means that it works fine when you browse to it using the map, but if you refresh the page or click [a link to the challenge](https://beta.freecodecamp.org/en/challenges/basic-css/change-the-color-of-text), it will break.rnrn### What should be changedrnThis line is causing the problem:rnhttps://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/82ec375f19b7289d0d9b996fc19f04bcff71fa6e/seed/challenges/01-responsive-web-design/basic-css.json#L50rnSpecifically, this part:rn```htmlrncolorrn```rnshould bern```htmlrncolorrn```rnrn### How to get startedrnrnCheck out the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) to get your local development environment set up.rnrnIf you need help, please go to our [contributors chatroom](https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors). We're always happy to answer any questions!rnrnHappy coding!rnrn---rnrnThis issue was originally reported by @alysabax in #16756

To get started:rnrnGet freeCodeCamp running locally: https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.mdrnrnJoin the Contributors chatroom: https://gitter.im/freecodecamp/contributorsrnrnAnd comment here to claim this issue. Then please post frequent updates so we can ensure this is ready in time for shipping beta :)

But in beta the quote `Happy Coding!` keeps on repeating on every challenge. rnSo, I think we should discuss whether it should be left as it is or should we implement the production's functionality. rn@QuincyLarson, I'll be waiting for your input on this :). rn### Browser Informationrn* Browser Name, Version: Chrome & Firefox(latest).rn* Operating System: Windows 10 Pro 32 Bit. rn* Mobile, Desktop, or Tablet: Desktop.

issue.title: [Beta] There are two scrollbars in the Preview Panel

issue.title: Audit codebase to make sure all relative protocol URLs start with 'HTTPS'
issue.body: We have been using and recommending protocol relative URLs like so:rnrn```htmlrn<script src='//code.jquery.com/jquery-2.2.3.min.js'></script>rn```rnrnThis was made popular by:rnhttps://www.paulirish.com/2010/the-protocol-relative-url/rnrnBut, I believe, this something we should be NOT be doing now on, since the author have long since updated their advice.rnrnMore reference: https://jeremywagner.me/blog/stop-using-the-protocol-relative-url/rnrnHence we need to audit our code-base for such uses, list them here and update the links after confirmation.rnrnOriginal seen in https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/pull/16488#issuecomment-358730193rn

issue.title: Using typeof challenge requires semicolons to be correct
issue.body: <!-- freeCodeCamp Issue Template -->rnrn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->rn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->rnrn<!-- NOTE: If your issue is CodePen Project / Test Suite related, please open it using the below URL instead -->rn<!-- https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/testable-projects-fcc/issues/new -->rnrn#### Challenge Namern<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->rn[Using typeof](https://www.freecodecamp.org/challenges/using-typeof)rnrn#### Issue Descriptionrn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->rnIn the Using typeof challenge, if one were to submit:rn```rnconsole.log(typeof '')rnrnconsole.log(typeof 0)rnrnconsole.log(typeof [])rnrnconsole.log(typeof {})rn```rnHowever, if semicolons were added:rn```rnconsole.log(typeof '');rnrnconsole.log(typeof 0);rnrnconsole.log(typeof []);rnrnconsole.log(typeof {});rn```rnThen all the tests are passed. Javascript does not require semicolons therefore this is simply complicating the challenge for users who do not use semicolons.rnrn#### Screenshotrn<!-- Add a screenshot of your issue -->rn![screenshot 2017-12-28 at 11 51 18 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19195374/34420205-8930390e-ebc5-11e7-9afc-ee7c5e7ace21.png)rnrnrn

issue.title: 'Escaping quotes in literal strings' test needs to be updated
issue.body: #### Challenge Namern[Beta: Escaping quotes in literal strings](https://beta.freecodecamp.org/en/challenges/basic-javascript/escaping-literal-quotes-in-strings)rnrn#### Issue DescriptionrnCurrently, the first test expects 6 escaped quotes and 10 normal quotes. The easiest way to pass it right now would be this:rn```jsrnvar myStr = 'I am a 'double quoted' string inside 'double quotes'.' ;rn// '' ' ' ' ' ' ' ' 'rn```rnud83dude02 rnThis test was made to expect this many quotes as a workaround for an issue that no longer exists.rnrn### What should be changedrnThis test should only expect 4 normal quotes and 2 escaped quotes. You can find the test here:rnhttps://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/5ee49d6f88217abcc0403a4d87b617d3b39375aa/seed/challenges/02-javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-javascript.json#L1058rnrnCheck out [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) to get your local development environment set up.rnrnIf you need help, please go to our [contributors chatroom](https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors). We're always happy to answer any questions!rnrnHappy coding!rnrn---rnrnThis issue was brought to my attention by @ncaron on Gitter. Thank you Niko!rnrnRelated to #16329

issue.title: Create a Set of Radio Buttons - Not Showing Best Practices
issue.body: In the *Create a Set of Radio Buttons* challenge of the *HTML5 and CSS* section (https://www.freecodecamp.org/challenges/create-a-set-of-radio-buttons), it states:rnrn> Here's an example of a radio button:rn> ```rn> <label><input type='radio' name='indoor-outdoor'> Indoor</label>rn> ```rnrnYet, in more official Mozilla documentation (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Forms/How_to_structure_an_HTML_form#The_%3Clabel%3E_element), it states:rnrn> Note that a widget can be nested inside its <label> element, like so:rn> rn> ```rn> <label for='name'>rn>   Name: <input type='text' id='name' name='user_name'>rn> </label>rn> ```rn> rn> Even in such cases however, it is considered best practice to set the for attribute because some assistive technologies do not understand implicit relationships between labels and widgets.rnrnThis was discussed here: https://forum.freecodecamp.org/t/anyone-notice-that-some-of-the-challenges-dont-demonstrate-best-practices/151348rnrnPlease update the challenge to reflect best practices.

Go to [https://www.freecodecamp.org/forgot](https://www.freecodecamp.org/forgot) and try to reset your password.rn2. Open a confirmation email from FCC to be directed to reset password page.rn3. Fill out your new password on the **New Password field** and **leave the Confirm Password blank.**rn4. Hit Change Password button.rn5. Try to login with your new password.rnrn#### Browser Informationrn<!-- Describe your workspace in which you are having issues-->rnrn* Browser Name, Version: Google Chrome Version 58.0.3029.110 (64-bit)rn* Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 16.04rn* On Desktoprnrnrn#### Screenshotrn<!-- Add a screenshot of your issue -->rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-35-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760732-8828ff7a-a005-11e7-8ab4-85dc8b787db3.png)rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-36-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760749-9f07e972-a005-11e7-9ff9-fbf809248c02.png)rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-36-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760754-a48a937c-a005-11e7-813e-7c85b5ed3a23.png)rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-37-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760763-ac096a6a-a005-11e7-948d-9e8270cbb3cc.png)rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-37-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760772-b15c4de8-a005-11e7-93a8-ce3e32e5ecfa.png)rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-37-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760776-b9ea7c8c-a005-11e7-93ec-49a53925d1df.png)rn![screenshot from 2017-09-23 01-38-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1570096/30760778-bc761790-a005-11e7-9c11-02e7d73c0ea1.png)rnrnrn

issue.body: We need to update the Code of Conduct Pagernhttps://www.freecodecamp.com/code-of-conductrnrn**'Spamming includes posting off-topic messages to disrupt discussions, promote a product, or solicit donations'** to include the over posting (i.e posting pictures every minute) of images, video and text that are related to the current conversation.  rnrnFor example: rnrnSpamming includes posting off-topic messages to disrupt discussions, promote a product, solicit donations or posting multiple large pictures, videos, streams and text in sequence that disrupts discussions'** rnrn**Suggestions welcome for better verbiage**rnrnThe source file is here:rnhttps://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/server/views/resources/code-of-conduct.jade

issue.title: Beta Challenge : Copy Array items using Slice (minified 'react' error)
issue.body: Challenge [copy-array-items-using-slice](http://beta.freecodecamp.com/en/challenges/basic-data-structures/copy-array-items-using-slice) has an issue.rnrnIf I simply return the array by slicing it, like this - rnrn```jsrnrnrnfunction forecast(arr) {rn  // change code below this linern  return arr.slice(2,4);rn}rnrn// do not change code below this linernconsole.log(forecast(['cold', 'rainy', 'warm', 'sunny', 'cool', 'thunderstorms']));rnrn```rnrnit returns a minified react error .rn![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/29104610/26752211/2efaede0-4868-11e7-9d2f-4b84a27ddac2.png)rnrnThe function returns the same value, as expected when I copy paste into the console.

issue.title: Word blanks exercise under Basic JS have a small bug
issue.body: Challenge [Word Blanks](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/word-blanks#?solution=%0Afunction%20wordBlanks(myNoun%2C%20myAdjective%2C%20myVerb%2C%20myAdverb)%20%7B%0A%20%20var%20result%20%3D%20%22%22%3B%0A%20%20%2F%2F%20Your%20code%20below%20this%20line%0A%20%20%0A%0A%20%20%2F%2F%20Your%20code%20above%20this%20line%0A%20%20return%20result%3B%0A%7D%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Change%20the%20words%20here%20to%20test%20your%20function%0AwordBlanks(%22dog%22%2C%20%22big%22%2C%20%22ran%22%2C%20%22quickly%22)%3B%0A) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/58.0.3029.110 Safari/537.36.rnPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.rnrnMy code:rn```javascriptrnrnfunction wordBlanks(myNoun, myAdjective, myVerb, myAdverb) {rn var result = '';rn // Your code below this linern rnrn // Your code above this linern return result;rn}rnrn// Change the words here to test your functionrnwordBlanks('dog', 'big', 'ran', 'quickly');rnrn```rnrnThe `var result = '';` should be inside ` // Your code below this line` and `// Your code above this line`rnrnlike this ud83dudc47 :rn```rn// Your code below this linernrnvar result = '';rnrn// Your code above this linernrn```rnrnInstead this is showing up as ud83dudc49 [like this](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/word-blanks#?solution=%0Afunction%20wordBlanks(myNoun%2C%20myAdjective%2C%20myVerb%2C%20myAdverb)%20%7B%0A%20%20var%20result%20%3D%20%22%22%3B%0A%20%20%2F%2F%20Your%20code%20below%20this%20line%0A%20%20%0A%0A%20%20%2F%2F%20Your%20code%20above%20this%20line%0A%20%20return%20result%3B%0A%7D%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Change%20the%20words%20here%20to%20test%20your%20function%0AwordBlanks(%22dog%22%2C%20%22big%22%2C%20%22ran%22%2C%20%22quickly%22)%3B%0A).rnrnThis can be very misleading for new coders like me as I/we think of not having to change `var result = '';` but do something else. This exercise is actually otherwise an easy exercise.rnrnThis issue also could be related to [#14630](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/issues/14630). Opened a new ticket as that was tagged `beta`.rnrnPS: There is no mentioning on whom to tag when reporting an issue. It would be great if you guys could mention a person to tag to each ticket.rn

issue.title: Pseudocode 'Break' Omission
issue.body: Challenge [Adding a default option in Switch statements](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/adding-a-default-option-in-switch-statements) rnrnIn this challenge's pseudocode it does omits the 'break;' statement where it is needed. This may be obvious and it's not a 'bug' per se but I'm sure it could confuse some users who are new to programming. rnrnSide note: rnrnLOVE THIS SITE!!! THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR HARD WORK!!!rnrn```pseudocodernswitch (num) {rn  case value1:rn    statement1;rn    break;rn  case value2:rn    statement2;rn    break;rn...rn  default:rn    defaultStatement;rn}rn```rnedit: challenge is still passable, is break unecessary? sorry for the confusion.

issue.title: Should change 'property' to 'name'?
issue.body: This challenge uses the phrase 'property and value pairs.' Shouldn't that be 'name and value pairs'? If I understand correctly, the term 'property' refers to the entire name/value pair, not simply the name.rnrnrnChallenge [Wherefore art thou](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/wherefore-art-thou#?solution=%0Afunction%20whatIsInAName(collection%2C%20source)%20%7B%0A%20%20var%20arr%20%3D%20%5B%5D%3B%0A%20%20for%20(var%20i%20%3D%200%3B%20i%20%3C%20collection.length%3B%20i%2B%2B)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20for%20(var%20j%20%3D%200%3B%20j%20%3C%20source.length%3B%20j%2B%2B)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20if%20(collection%5Bi%5D.hasOwnProperty(source%5Bj%5D)%20%26%26%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20collection%5Bi%5D%20%3D%3D%3D%20source%5Bj%5D)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20arr.push(collection%5Bi%5D)%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%7D%0A%20%20return%20arr%3B%0A%7D%0A%0A%2F%2F%20function%20whatIsInAName(collection%2C%20source)%20%7B%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20var%20arr%20%3D%20%5B%5D%3B%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20for%20(var%20i%20%3D%200%3B%20i%20%3C%20collection.length%3B%20i%2B%2B)%20%7B%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20%20%20if%20(collection%5Bi%5D.keys().includes(source.keys())%20%26%26%20collection%5Bi%5D.values().includes(source.values()))%20%7B%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20%20%20%20%20arr.push(collection%5Bi%5D)%3B%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20%7D%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20return%20arr%3B%0A%2F%2F%20%7D%0A%0A%0AwhatIsInAName(%0A%5B%7Bfirst%3A%20%22Romeo%22%2C%20last%3A%20%22Montague%22%7D%2C%20%7Bfirst%3A%20%22Mercutio%22%2C%20last%3A%20null%7D%2C%20%0A%7Bfirst%3A%20%22Tybalt%22%2C%20last%3A%20%22Capulet%22%7D%5D%2C%20%0A%7Blast%3A%20%22Capulet%22%7D)%3B%0A) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.12; rv:52.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/52.0.rnPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.rnrn

CatPhotoApp

rnrn

Click here for cat photos.

rnrnrnrn

Kitty ipsum dolor sit amet, shed everywhere shed everywhere stretching attack your ankles chase the red dot, hairball run catnip eat the grass sniff.

rn

Purr jump eat the grass rip the couch scratched sunbathe, shed everywhere rip the couch sleep in the sink fluffy fur catnip scratched.

rnrn```rnrnIssue description:rnDo NOT replace href with #...it is the link itself to be replaced with #. Bad example in the directions.rnrn

Change the array to [2, 5, 7].rn

issue.title: Challenge [specify-exact-number-of-matches] The last test is wrong
issue.body: Challenge [specify-exact-number-of-matches](http://beta.freecodecamp.com/en/challenges/regular-expressions/specify-exact-number-of-matches) has an issue.rn rnThe last test is: Your regex should match 'Timber' with 30 m's in it.rnrnIt should be NOT match Timber with 30 m's in it because the assignment is:rnrnChange the regex timRegex to match the word 'Timber' only when it has four letter m's.rnrnThe last test causes a fail when writing the following code:rnrnlet timStr = 'Timmmmber';rnlet timRegex = /m{4}/; // rnlet result = timRegex.test(timStr);rnrnThe tests are:rnYour regex should use curly brackets.rnYour regex should not match 'Timber'rnYour regex should not match 'Timmber'rnYour regex should not match 'Timmmber'rnYour regex should match 'Timmmmber'rnYour regex should match 'Timber' with 30 m's in it.rnrn

issue.title: Title Case a Sentence: Unclear what the tests want as output of the function
issue.body: Challenge [Title Case a Sentence](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/title-case-a-sentence) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/56.0.2924.87 Safari/537.36.rnPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.rnrnMy code:rn```javascriptrnfunction titleCase(str) {rn var newString=str.split(' ');rn var newString1='';rn var newString2=''';rn for(var i=0; i0)rn {rn rn newString1+=newString[i].charAt(j).toLowerCase(); rn rn }rn elsern {rn newString1=newString[i].charAt(j).toUpperCase(); rn rn }rn }rn newString2+=newString1 + ' ';rn }rn newString2=newString2.trim()+ '''+'.';rn return newString2;rn}rnrntitleCase('sHoRt AnD sToUt');rnrn```rnrn

issue.title: Misleading Instructions in 'ES6: Set Default Parameters' Challenge
issue.body: <!-- freeCodeCamp Issue Template -->rnrn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->rn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->rnrn<!-- NOTE: If your issue is CodePen Project / Test Suite related, please open it using the below URL instead -->rn<!-- https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/testable-projects-fcc/issues/new -->rnrn#### Challenge Namern<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->rn[ES6: Set Default Parameter for Your Functions](http://beta.freecodecamp.com/en/challenges/es6/set-default-parameters-for-your-functions)rnrn#### Issue Descriptionrn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->rnThe current instructions are misleading. They currently read:rn* Modify the function `increment` by adding default parameters so it will always return a valid number and it will add 1 to `number` if `value` is not specified.rnrnThe modification made to the function `increment` in the code below do not cause the function to always return a valid number, for instance:rn* `increment('foo') // returns 'foo1'`rnrn#### Browser Informationrn<!-- Describe your workspace in which you are having issues-->rnrn* Browser Name, Version: Chromium 55.02883.87 (64-bit)rn* Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04, 64 bit-OSrn* Mobile, Desktop, or Tablet: Desktoprnrn#### Your Codern<!-- If relevant, paste all of your challenge code in here -->rn```jsrn'use strict';rnfunction increment(number, value = 1) {rn    return number + value;rn}rnconsole.log(increment(5, 2)); // returns 7rnconsole.log(increment(5)); // returns NaNrn```rnrn#### Suggested ChangernRewrite the instructions to read:rn* Modify the function `increment` by adding default parameters so that it will add 1 to `number` if `value` is not specified.rnrn#### Screenshotrn<!-- Add a screenshot of your issue -->rn![defaultparameterspass](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18408781/23878875/e3ebdc8c-0817-11e7-9399-24d5ed39e5bc.png)rnrnrn

issue.title: Add .vscode to .gitignore
issue.body: I was wondering if we could add `.vscode`, the directory created by Visual Studio Code for editor settings, to the .gitignore file? This would both prevent people from accidentally committing their editor settings, and make working with git a little easier by not having to worry about that file accidentally being tracked by git. rnrnI wouldn't mind creating a PR for this one, I just thought I should follow convention and create an issue on GitHub first. ud83dude01 It's a simple fix, so if it's easier for an admin or moderator to do it, that's also fine! ud83dude04

issue.title: [beta] Clarify instruction for 'Basic Data Structures: Access an Array's Contents Using Bracket Notation'
issue.body: Challenge [access-an-arrays-contents-using-bracket-notation](http://beta.freecodecamp.com/en/challenges/basic-data-structures/access-an-arrays-contents-using-bracket-notation) has an issue.rnrn### Hey, Contributor!rnIn the final paragraph of the instruction, I think the contents of the parenthesis could be slightly clarified.rnrnI suggest we change '(1st index)' to `(index 1)`, as '1st index' could be interpreted as the first index of an array - **index 0**.rnrnIf you want to fix this, please read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) to get started.rnrnWhen you're all set, replace [this line](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/seed/challenges/02-javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-data-structures.json#L91) with the following, and make your commit.rnrn`'In order to complete this challenge, set the 2nd position (index 1) of myArray to anything you want, besides 'b'.'`rnrnIf you have any questions, please come chat with us in the [Contributors Chat Room](https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors).rnrnHappy Coding :smile:rn

issue.title: Symmetric Difference Algorithm not Testing for Symmetric Difference
issue.body: While I understand that the challenge can come up with all sorts of rules, it is quite confusing since it really isn't testing for the _symmetric difference_ between all the given arrays.rnrnExample: rnsym([1, 2, 5], [2, 3, 5], [3, 4, 5]) should return [1, 4, 5]rnrnThat isn't _'correct'_ since the actual symmetric difference among the 3 arrays should be [1,4].rnrnOn the challenge help, a link to a [youtube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PxffSUQRkG4) was provided. rnrnIn the video, the following example was given:rnA = [1,2,3,4]rnB = [3,4,5,6]rnC = [2,4,6,7]rnAnd the symmetric difference between the 3 sets is [1,2,5,7]. Comparing with the answers expected from the challenge, which in this instance would be [1,4,5,7].rnrnOnce again, I know that the challenges can have its own rules to it. I just thought that I should point out this fact. rn

That is not accurate, as that will actually throw a ReferenceError (`loc is not defined`) exception instead of outputting the `'undefined'` string.rnrn#### Screenshotrn![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11248671/22043490/179ff6ae-dd10-11e6-98d2-3650b48e6111.png)rnrnrnrn

issue.title: Wrong solution is accepted when submitted
issue.body: Challenge [Return Largest Numbers in Arrays](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/return-largest-numbers-in-arrays#?solution=%0Afunction%20largestOfFour(arr)%20%7B%0A%20%20return%20arr.map(function(subArray)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20return%20subArray.reduce(function(prev%2C%20curr)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20return%20(curr%20%3E%20prev%20%3F%20curr%20%3A%20prev)%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%2C%200)%3B%0A%20%20%7D)%3B%0A%7D%0A%0AlargestOfFour(%5B%5B4%2C%205%2C%201%2C%203%5D%2C%20%5B13%2C%2027%2C%2018%2C%2026%5D%2C%20%5B32%2C%2035%2C%2037%2C%2039%5D%2C%20%5B1000%2C%201001%2C%20857%2C%201%5D%5D)%3B%0A) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/55.0.2883.87 Safari/537.36.rnThe code below uses map/reduce as suggested in the medium forum (I've reviewed the solutions over there) and is accepted when submitted.rnrnThe problem is that there is an assumption that in every subarray not all of the values are negatives and it is not shown in the description of the problem. That is, if one of the subarray contains only negatives values, the accepted solution below isn't correct.rnrnMy code:rn```javascriptrnrnfunction largestOfFour(arr) {rn return arr.map(function(subArray) {rn return subArray.reduce(function(prev, curr) {rn return (curr > prev ? curr : prev);rn }, 0);rn });rn}rnrnlargestOfFour([[4, 5, 1, 3], [13, 27, 18, 26], [32, 35, 37, 39], [1000, 1001, 857, 1]]);rnrn```rnrn

issue.title: Profile Lookup confuses with same param name and attribute name
issue.body: Challenge [Profile Lookup](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/profile-lookup#?solution=%0A%2F%2FSetup%0Avar%20contacts%20%3D%20%5B%0A%20%20%20%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22firstName%22%3A%20%22Akira%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22lastName%22%3A%20%22Laine%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22number%22%3A%20%220543236543%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22likes%22%3A%20%5B%22Pizza%22%2C%20%22Coding%22%2C%20%22Brownie%20Points%22%5D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22firstName%22%3A%20%22Harry%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22lastName%22%3A%20%22Potter%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22number%22%3A%20%220994372684%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22likes%22%3A%20%5B%22Hogwarts%22%2C%20%22Magic%22%2C%20%22Hagrid%22%5D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22firstName%22%3A%20%22Sherlock%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22lastName%22%3A%20%22Holmes%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22number%22%3A%20%220487345643%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22likes%22%3A%20%5B%22Intriguing%20Cases%22%2C%20%22Violin%22%5D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22firstName%22%3A%20%22Kristian%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22lastName%22%3A%20%22Vos%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22number%22%3A%20%22unknown%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22likes%22%3A%20%5B%22Javascript%22%2C%20%22Gaming%22%2C%20%22Foxes%22%5D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%5D%3B%0A%0A%0Afunction%20lookUpProfile(prop1%2C%20prop2)%7B%0A%2F%2F%20Only%20change%20code%20below%20this%20line%0A%20%20var%20i%20%3D%200%3B%0A%20%20while(i%20!%3D%20contacts.length)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20if(contacts%5Bi%5D.firstName%20%3D%3D%20prop1)%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20console.log(%22got%20it%22)%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20if(contacts%5Bi%5D%5Bprop2%5D)%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20return%20contacts%5Bi%5D%5Bprop2%5D%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7Delse%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20return%20%22No%20such%20property%22%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%20%20i%2B%2B%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%20%20return%20%22No%20such%20contact%22%3B%0A%2F%2F%20Only%20change%20code%20above%20this%20line%0A%7D%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Change%20these%20values%20to%20test%20your%20function%0AlookUpProfile(%22Akira%22%2C%20%22likes%22)%3B%0A) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/55.0.2883.87 Safari/537.36.rnPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.rnrnMy code:rn```javascriptrnrn//Setuprnvar contacts = [rn {rn 'firstName': 'Akira',rn 'lastName': 'Laine',rn 'number': '0543236543',rn 'likes': ['Pizza', 'Coding', 'Brownie Points']rn },rn {rn 'firstName': 'Harry',rn 'lastName': 'Potter',rn 'number': '0994372684',rn 'likes': ['Hogwarts', 'Magic', 'Hagrid']rn },rn {rn 'firstName': 'Sherlock',rn 'lastName': 'Holmes',rn 'number': '0487345643',rn 'likes': ['Intriguing Cases', 'Violin']rn },rn {rn 'firstName': 'Kristian',rn 'lastName': 'Vos',rn 'number': 'unknown',rn 'likes': ['Javascript', 'Gaming', 'Foxes']rn }rn];rnrnrnfunction lookUpProfile(prop1, prop2){rn// Only change code below this linern var i = 0;rn while(i != contacts.length) {rn if(contacts[i].firstName == prop1){rn if(contacts[i][prop2]){rn return contacts[i][prop2];rn }else{rn return 'No such property';rn }rn }rn i++;rn }rn return 'No such contact';rn// Only change code above this linern}rnrn// Change these values to test your functionrnlookUpProfile('Akira', 'likes');rnrn```rnrnIn the Profile Lookup challenge code, the lookUpProfile function's first parameter name is 'firstName' which is the same as the array objects 'firstName' properties.rnrnThe problem is that a novice learner like myself can pass the test without even realizing that the lookUpProfile function's first parameter 'firstName' is not at all the same thing as the array objects 'firstName' properties. It's really easy to assume they are one and the same. rnrnI propose we change the lookUpProfile function's parameter 'firstName' to something like 'prop1' (for example like I have it posted here in the code above). Honestly, while I was solving this challenge it was very confusing at first until I realized that 'firstName' was used for two different things (function parameter and the array objects properties) in the code.rnrnAny thoughts or other suggestions. rnrnrn

issue.body: Challenge [Understand String Immutability](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/understand-string-immutability) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/54.0.2840.71 Safari/537.36.rnPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.rnrnMy code:rn```javascriptrnrn// Setuprnvar myStr = 'Jello World';rnrn// Only change code below this linernrnmyStr[0] = 'H'; // Fix Mernrn```rnrn## Current InstructionsrnrnThe current instructions rnrn> Correct the assignment to `myStr` to achieve the desired effect.rnrnare a bit vague, as pointed out [in this comment](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/issues/9335#issuecomment-260647466).rnrnChallenges should require some level of critical thinking but even so, these instructions are still too unclear.rnrn## Suggested Changernrn[This line of code](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/395b62e4c67fd36aec459c5681783c3cea83a7e2/seed/challenges/01-front-end-development-certification/basic-javascript.json#L1538) needs to be changed to something like this:rnrn> Correct the assignment to `myStr` to achieve the desired effect that is intended by `myStr[0] = 'H';`.rn

issue.title: This exercise does not make sense.
issue.body: Challenge [Local Scope and Functions](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/local-scope-and-functions#?solution=%0A%0Afunction%20myLocalScope()%20%7B%0A%20%20myVar%20%3D%20'use%20strict'%3B%0A%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20console.log(myVar)%3B%0A%7D%0AmyLocalScope()%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Run%20and%20check%20the%20console%0A%2F%2F%20myVar%20is%20not%20defined%20outside%20of%20myLocalScope%0Aconsole.log(myVar)%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Now%20remove%20the%20console%20log%20line%20to%20pass%20the%20test%0A%0A) has an issue.rnUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/54.0.2840.71 Safari/537.36.rnPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.rnrnMy code:rn```javascriptrnrnrnfunction myLocalScope() {rn myVar = 'use strict';rn rn rn console.log(myVar);rn}rnmyLocalScope();rnrn// Run and check the consolern// myVar is not defined outside of myLocalScopernconsole.log(myVar);rnrn// Now remove the console log line to pass the testrnrnrn```rnrnThis Challenge asks the user to make a variable.. rn1) In it's initialized state there is the line 'use strict'; So the assumption I made was that the instruction is to assign the string to myVar. rn2) Fine. that's what I did, then it looks like the goal is to run it, see it fail (because the last line is a call to print variable 'myVar' which will not work because it is only a local variable within the function. rn3) Then the 'commented out' instructions say to comment that line out. My expectation would be that then the illegal call would no longer be there and the challenge would pass! But this is not what happens!!! Instead it just gives 2 errors: 'no global variable 'myVar' ' What does that Mean???? Nowhere in the commented out instructions, or Challenge instructions does it ask to make a global variable!!! rnrnNote that even if I DO create a global variable .. the challenge does not pass either! rnrnSo what is required to make this challenge pass? Perhaps the instructions for this challenge are not clearly stated? rnrncrnrn![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22585181/20237048/677723b4-a87c-11e6-8f50-495659a46600.png)rn

issue.title: Suggestion: Reorder the instructions to follow: top, right, bottom, left
issue.body:
This Is Technically correct.nnHowever, in the instructions, and in the code, I recommend that you instruct the student to set the borders in the following order: top, right, bottom, left.nncurrently you instruct and list tests in the order top, left, ..nnReason for suggestion is that the shortcut method runs top, right, bottom, left. nClockwise starting at the top.nnIf the material is always presented in that order, students will always be thinking in that order, and thus subconsciously, and naturally pick up the mentality of thinking of border/margin, etc in this order.nThis will enable Many to automagically , naturally, think of these items in that order, and will have no trouble 'remembering' the order later. nnAs it is, the first intro sets the mind, though process, and coding exercise in a different order.nNow there are more than one ordering in the student's mind, resulting in a conflict, or an unlearning, or at least more of an effort to remember which is the default.nnthanks for taking this consideration into account.nnSimply reordering the text of the directions can achieve this subtle memory enhancement.nnChallenge [Add Different Padding to Each Side of an Element](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/add-different-padding-to-each-side-of-an-element#?solution=%0A%3Cstyle%3E%0A%20%20.injected-text%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20margin-bottom%3A%20-25px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20text-align%3A%20center%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20.box%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20border-style%3A%20solid%3B%0A%20%20%20%20border-color%3A%20black%3B%0A%20%20%20%20border-width%3A%205px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20text-align%3A%20center%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20.yellow-box%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20background-color%3A%20yellow%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding%3A%2010px%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%0A%20%20.red-box%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20background-color%3A%20red%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-top%3A%2040px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-right%3A%2020px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-bottom%3A%2020px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-left%3A%2040px%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20.green-box%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20background-color%3A%20green%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-top%3A%2040px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-right%3A%2020px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-bottom%3A%2020px%3B%0A%20%20%20%20padding-left%3A%2040px%3B%20%20%7D%0A%3C%2Fstyle%3E%0A%3Ch5%20class%3D%22injected-text%22%3Emargin%3C%2Fh5%3E%0A%0A%3Cdiv%20class%3D%22box%20yellow-box%22%3E%0A%20%20%3Ch5%20class%3D%22box%20red-box%22%3Epadding%3C%2Fh5%3E%0A%20%20%3Ch5%20class%3D%22box%20green-box%22%3Epadding%3C%2Fh5%3E%0A%3C%2Fdiv%3E%0A) issue.title: Merge Wiki Contributing article into Contributing.md
issue.body: We want a single source of truth that reflects all the steps involved in setting up Free Code Camp locally and contributing to it. That single document should be Contributing.mdnnCurrently, we also have http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-fork-and-maintain-a-local-instance-of-free-code-camp/19116, which is a much more comprehensive article. nnWe should do the following:n- [ ] work all the points from the wiki article into this repo's Contributing.mdn- [ ] update the wiki article, clearing its instructions and instead referring readers to this repo's Contributing.mdn

issue.title: Filter: Rewrite double negative
issue.body: Challenge [Filter Arrays with filter](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/filter-arrays-with-filter) has an issue.nnThe intro sentence uses a double negative:nn> The filter method is used to iterate through an array and filter out elements where a given condition is not true.nnI suggest re-writing in the positive because it's easier to read and understand. Also, it's how I happen to think of `filter`, and maybe others do too. Here I made that change, plus removed 'filter' from its own definition, and changed it from passive to active voice:nn_The filter method iterates through an array and selects elements where a given condition is true._n

issue.title: Update Contribution guidelines
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Challenge Namenn<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->nnGithub PR commits can now be squashedn#### Issue Descriptionnn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->nnThe Contributing.md file mentions the following:nn```nMany Pull Requests, especially first Pull Requests, require correction ornupdating. If you have used the GitHub interface to create your PR, you will neednto close your PR, create a new branch, and re-submit. This is because you cannotnsquash your commits via the GitHub interface.n```nnHowever, as of [April 2, 2016](https://github.com/blog/2141-squash-your-commits), Github PR commits can be squashed while merging them. So I think that the text needs to be update but not sure what to replace it with. n

issue.title: Update Answer to 'How did Free Code Camp get started?'
issue.body: Currently in the FAQs in the ['About'](https://www.freecodecamp.com/about) section of FreeCodeCamp, we have a question and answernn> ### How did Free Code Camp get started?n> n> Quincy started our open source community in 2014. He is now just one of many active contributors.nnRecently, @CodeNonprofit published a Medium article ['How I made My First Million Dollars in Pro Bono Code'](How I made my first million dollars %28in pro bono code%29). I feel like this exciting article chronicles part of Free Code Camp's beginnings that appropriately adds to the answer of how Free Code Camp started.n### Suggested Changenn[This line](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/server/views/resources/about.jade#L158) would need to be edited to something like this.nn> ### How did Free Code Camp get started?n> n> Quincy started our open source community in 2014. He is now just one of many active contributors. You can read more in [this Medium story](https://medium.freecodecamp.com/how-i-made-my-first-million-dollars-in-pro-bono-code-86f911040484#.pgftldy1b).n

issue.title: Reword Sentence in Smallest Common Multiple
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Challenge Namenn<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->nnhttps://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/smallest-common-multiplen#### Issue Descriptionnn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->nnThe third paragraph in the Smallest Common Multiple challenge needs to be rewritten for ease of reading. nn> e.g. for 1 and 3 - find the smallest common multiple of both 1 and 3 that is evenly divisible by all numbers between 1 and 3.nnThe `e.g.` abbreviation seems unnecessary and may be confusing for people unfamiliar with it.n#### To ContributorsnnChange [this sentence](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/e610f64ff93c525b646648ae7b536e413e7710d7/seed/challenges/01-front-end-development-certification/intermediate-bonfires.json#L805) to something like this.nn> For example, for 1 and 3, you'll need to find the smallest common multiple of both 1 and 3 that is also evenly divisible by all numbers _between_ 1 and 3. The answer here would be 6.nnPlease first read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) before taking care of this issue. And feel free to visit the [Contributors](https://goo.gl/XNSD0U) chat room if you have any questions about contributing. We're there to assist.n#### Screenshotnn<!-- Add a screenshot of your issue -->nn![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2754821/17642010/997aacec-60eb-11e6-8922-15f2d349469b.png)n

issue.title: 'Check for palindromes' passes with full uppercasing as well
issue.body: Challenge [Check for Palindromes](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/check-for-palindromes#?solution=function%20palindrome%28str%29%20%7B%0A%20%20str%20%3D%20str.toUpperCase%28%29.replace%28%2F%5CW%7C_%2Fg%2C%20''%29%3B%0A%20%20return%20str%20%3D%3D%3D%20str.split%28''%29.reverse%28%29.join%28''%29%3B%0A%7D%0Apalindrome%28%22eye%22%29%3B) has an issue.nUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/51.0.2704.84 Safari/537.36.nPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.nnMy code:nn``` javascriptnfunction palindrome(str) {n str = str.toUpperCase().replace(/W|_/g, '');n return str === str.split('').reverse().join('');n}npalindrome('eye');n```nnA minor issue, but since the instructions state it should be lowercased, a test for lowercasing should be added. Currently it works as long as the case is the same throughout.n

issue.title: 'Profile Lookup' instructions are ambiguous and don't match 'accepted solution'
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- NOTE: ISSUES ARE NOT FOR CODE HELP - Ask for Help at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Help -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Challenge NamennProfile Lookupnn<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->nnhttps://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/profile-lookupn#### Issue Descriptionnn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->nnThe instructions include the following: nn> If firstName does not correspond to any contacts then return 'No such contact'n> n> If prop does not correspond to any valid properties then return 'No such property'nnProblem 1:nAccording to the instructions, the function should not return 'No such property' if prop corresponds to a valid property -- period -- regardless of the associated firstName.  However, the solution offered at https://freecodecamp.github.io/wiki/en/challenge-profile-lookup/  will return 'No such property' in the case that there is an invalid property paired with a valid firstName -- even though the property exists paired with a different firstName.nnProblem 2:nIt is possible to have both an invalid firstName and an invalid prop.  In that case it is not clear, according to the instructions, what should be returned:  both 'No such contact' and 'No such property'?nnSuggested solution:nModify the last line of the instructions to say:  n'If the prop argument does not correspond to any valid properties of any contact matching the firstName argument, then return: 'No' firstName 'has a' prop 'property'.n

issue.title: Change the name of 'collapse all challenges' in a map menu (UX)
issue.body: For not native English speakers 'collapse all' sounds like 'delete all challenges', so they probably never click this button.nnI was always wondering why do we need such a big button to destroy all challenge's progress until I found this step in a TODO testing list and only then I've discovered this great feature :)nnI'm not a native speaker, so need help with a more appropriate word.nPossible variants:n- Hide all challengesn- Hide all sub-challengesn- Minify all challengesn

issue.title: Add a caret symbol to connect-mongo version
issue.body: A caret symbol, `^` needs to be added [here](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/package.json#L46). So the result should look like this:n`'connect-mongo': '^1.3.2',`.nPlease review [**Contribution Guidelines**](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) before opening a PR, thank you!n

issue.title: Add a hat symbol to babel-eslint version
issue.body: A carat (aka hat) symbol, `^` needs to be added [here](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/package.json#L35). So the result should look like this:n`'babel-eslint': '^6.1.2',`.n

issue.title: Missing semi-colon for valid JS
issue.body:
Challenge [Accessing Nested Objects](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/accessing-nested-objects) has an issue.nUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/51.0.2704.103 Safari/537.36.nPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.n## DescriptionnnThe sample code is missing a semi-colon.n## How to Fixnn[This line of code](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/75bba05718dc0bb288beafb154ecc4b0181e8d64/seed/challenges/01-front-end-development-certification/basic-javascript.json#L4397) needs to be edited so that there is a semi-colon in the correct place. The edits you make in your code should be from the red to the green:nn``` diffn- '
var ourStorage = {
'desk': {
'drawer': 'stapler'
},
'cabinet': {
'top drawer': {
'folder1': 'a file',
'folder2': 'secrets'
},
'bottom drawer': 'soda'
}
}
ourStorage.cabinet['top drawer'].folder2; // 'secrets'
ourStorage.desk.drawer; // 'stapler'
',n+ '
var ourStorage = {
'desk': {
'drawer': 'stapler'
},
'cabinet': {
'top drawer': {
'folder1': 'a file',
'folder2': 'secrets'
},
'bottom drawer': 'soda'
}
};
ourStorage.cabinet['top drawer'].folder2; // 'secrets'
ourStorage.desk.drawer; // 'stapler'
',n```n## To ContributorsnnPlease first read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md) before taking care of this issue. And feel free to visit the [Contributors Help](https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/HelpContributors) chat room if you have any questions about helping. We're there to help.nnThis issue is labeled as `first-timers-only` so only individuals who have not contributed to the main repository for Free Code Camp can resolve this issue. Thank you for understanding.n## Screenshotnn![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2754821/16902956/8a710b14-4c24-11e6-83dd-050de1efb0f7.png)n

issue.title: videos/big-o-notation-a-few-examples 'exponential time' -> 'polynomial time'
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- NOTE: ISSUES ARE NOT FOR CODE HELP - Ask for Help at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Help -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Challenge Namenn<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->nnhttps://www.freecodecamp.com/videos/big-o-notation-a-few-examplesn#### Issue Descriptionnn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->nnIn the discussion and questions concerning big-o notation, O(N^2) is referred to as 'exponential time', which is wrong. nnO(N^C), where C is any constant greater than 1 (e.g. 2) is called 'polynomial time'. nnExponential time looks like O(C^N), where the input variable (N) is in the exponent.nnRoughly speaking, the complexity class P (polynomial time solvable) is what we (or complexity theorists) consider 'easy' - or at least solvable.nnExponential time algorithms typically have no hope of being solved on large inputs (and therefore are good candidates for heuristics, or approximations).nnFor a bit more intuition, an algorithm with O(N^2) complexity may not be a good candidate for real-time processing in your web app - but it may be perfectly suitable for less time critical tasks. With an algorithm like this, you might decide to pre-compute some solutions as a workaround.nnWith an exponential time algorithm O(C^N), on the other hand, the sun may burn out before your computation ends.nnConcerning O(infinity) - notice the lack of an input variable (N), and that infinity isn't a number. It's probably best to replace that idea with a statement about non-terminating routines. This might lead into a discussion about the halting problem, for example.n

True or False?nnThe correct answer should be false (but is currently true). Data speed is measured in bits per second.n

issue.title: Misspelling of Brackets
issue.body: Misspelling in the challenge question: nAccess MultiDimensional Arrays With IndexesnOne way to think of a multi-dimensional array, is as an array of arrays. When you use brackets to access your array, the first set of **bracket** refers to the entries in the outer-most (the first level) array, and each additional pair of brackets refers to the next level of entries inside.nnshould be plural 'brackets'n

issue.title: Object Oriented and Functional Programming DESPERATELY needs rewrite!
issue.body: Challenge [Iterate over Arrays with map](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/iterate-over-arrays-with-map#?solution=var%20timesFour%20%3D%20oldArray.map%28function%28val%29%7B%0A%20%20return%20val%20*%204%3B%0A%7D%29%3B%0A%0A%0Avar%20oldArray%20%3D%20%5B1%2C2%2C3%2C4%2C5%5D%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Only%20change%20code%20below%20this%20line.%0A%0Avar%20newArray%20%3D%20oldArray%3B%0A) has an issue.nnThe description of this waypoint is completely inadequate. It reads:nn> The map method is a convenient way to iterate through arrays. Here's an example usage:n> n> ```n> var timesFour = oldArray.map(function(val){n>  return val * 4;n> });n> ```n> n> The map method will iterate through every element of the array, creating a new array with values that have been modified by the callback function, and return it. Note that it does not modify the original array.n> n> In our example the callback only uses the value of the array element (the val argument) but your callback can also include arguments for the index and array being acted on.nnIt does not really explain the syntax, what results the map method produces and requires readers to speak CSspeak and decipher many implicit unstated things. nnI am struggling to understand anything in the section _Object Oriented and Functional Programming_, not because the concepts are difficult but because the lessons are poorly constructed. I'm referring to Crockford, Eloquent JS and Codeacademy to provide information written in a manner that I _can_ understand. nnForgive my shortness, I just hope that my suggestion that this need a rewrite is taken up.n

Could probably be suitable as a first-timer-contribution.nn![Typo showed in screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/ZNxsdIa.png?1)nnI think it would make sense to rephrase n**`if` / `if else` statements**nnintonn**`if` / `else if`statements**.nnThis would make the instructions more aligned with the actual syntax.n

Intel Mac OS X 10_10_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/51.0.2704.103 Safari/537.36.nPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.nnMy code:nn``` javascriptnnfunction chainToSwitch(val) {n var answer = '';n // Only change code below this linenn /**n if (val === 'bob') {n answer = 'Marley';n } else if (val === 42) {n answer = 'The Answer';n } else if (val === 1) {n answer = 'There is no #1';n } else if (val === 99) {n answer = 'Missed me by this much!';n } else if (val === 7) {n answer = 'Ate Nine';n }**/n switch(val) {n case 'bob':n answer = 'Marley';n break;n case 42:n answer = 'The Answer';n break;n case 1:n answer = 'There is no #1';n break;n case 99:n answer = 'Missed me by this much!';n break;n case 7:n answer = 'Ate Nine';n break;n }n // Only change code above this line n return answer; n}nn// Change this value to testnchainToSwitch(7);nnn```n

issue.title: Improve instructions for Understanding case sensitivity in variables challenge
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- NOTE: ISSUES ARE NOT FOR CODE HELP - Ask for Help at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Help -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Understanding Case Sensitivity in Variablesnn<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->nnIt looks like a learner had problem in understanding the instructions for [this](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/understanding-case-sensitivity-in-variables) challenge.nnThe instructions currently read nn> Fix the variable declarations and assignments so their names use camelCase.nnMaybe we can change it along the lines of  nn> Modify the existing declarations and assignments so their names use camelCase. n> In other words, do not create any new variables; just change and fix existing incorrect variable names in the declaration and assignment statements.n

issue.title: Show campers how to add name to certificate
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- NOTE: ISSUES ARE NOT FOR CODE HELP - Ask for Help at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Help -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Issue DescriptionnnWe frequently get emails from campers complaining that their name doesn't show up on their certificates. I respond to them with the following instructions:nn'We pull all your biographical information directly from GitHub. So you just need to add your name to your GitHub account. Then go back to your Free Code Camp code portfolio and click the 'update my profile from GitHub' button. Then your name will appear on your certificate.nnInstead of having to answer these emails, if a camper doesn't have a name, we could just put a short message like this right on their certificate where there name would normally go. I propose the following copy for this, which is short enough to avoid an ugly line wrap:nn'Add name on GitHub then update FCC'nnYou'll do this in boot/user.js in the showCert function.n#### Screenshotnn![](https://www.evernote.com/l/Ar_-08-MMpdFhqdWJ7LG48XTeabW-m3BePQB/image.png)n

issue.title: Where art thou - Intermediate Algorithm
issue.body: I'm being very pedantic: nn1) The quote is not 'where art thou?', it's 'wherefore art thou?' n2) The meaning is not 'where are you?', but 'why are you?' i.e. 'why were you born a Montague?'nnChallenge [Where art thou](https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/where-art-thou) has an issue.nUser Agent is: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/601.5.17 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/9.1 Safari/537.86.5.nPlease describe how to reproduce this issue, and include links to screenshots if possible.nnMy code:nn``` javascriptnnfunction whereAreYou(collection, source) {n // What's in a name?n var arr = [];n // Only change code below this linennn // Only change code above this linen return arr;n}nnwhereAreYou([{ first: 'Romeo', last: 'Montague' }, { first: 'Mercutio', last: null }, { first: 'Tybalt', last: 'Capulet' }], { last: 'Capulet' });nn```n

issue.title: Free Code Camp logo in nav bar should redirect to next challenge
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- NOTE: ISSUES ARE NOT FOR CODE HELP - Ask for Help at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Help -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Issue DescriptionnnCurrently the Free Code Camp logo button in the navbar redirects to '/' which redirects to the home page if campers are unauthenticated and the /challenges/next-challenge route if they are authenticated. Rather than send campers to '/' we can just send them directly to /challenges/next-challenge which will go ahead and get them started, even if they haven't authenticated. nnWe recently discovered that 25% of people who visit or landing page click on this logo for some reason. We don't know why, but it doesn't make any sense to send them right back to the landing page.n

issue.title: 1 isn't a prime number, because it's only divisible by itself.
issue.body: <!-- FreeCodeCamp Issue Template -->nn<!-- NOTE: ISSUES ARE NOT FOR CODE HELP - Ask for Help at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Help -->nn<!-- Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue -->nn<!-- Remove any heading sections you did not fill out -->n#### Challenge Namenn<!-- Insert link to challenge below -->nnSum All Primesn#### Issue Descriptionnn<!-- Describe below when the issue happens and how to reproduce it -->nnIt is not true that one is not a prime number because it's only divisible by itself. If one applies the definition of a prime number - a number only divisible by 1 and by itself - 1 would be prime, as it has been historically. It's not because that would be inconvenient.nI suggest to change this sentence to _By convention, 1 is not a prime number._n

issue.title: Friendly Date Ranges Issues
issue.body: #### Friendly Date Rangesnnhttps://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/friendly-date-rangesn#### Issue Description:nnProblem constraints are a little unclear/contradictory and test assertions are problematic (see below):nnThe last 2 constraints are:nn(['2022-09-05', '2023-09-04']) should return ['September 5th, 2022','September 4th'].nnand:nn(['2022-09-05', '2023-09-05']) should return ['September 5th, 2022','September 5th, 2023'].nnThese are the same sets of dates, except in one the second date is Sept. 4 while the other is Sept. 5, but the expected results for each from the function are different in how they include the years. I don't know how to satisfy this constraint without hardcoding it, which I did.nnBecause they are a year apart, I would assume both should include the year in the answer for clarity.nnIt is also unclear in the instructions when to include the year and where (in the first or second entry on the answer). For example, the instructions indicate 'if the date range begins in the current year and ends within one year, the year should not be displayed at the beginning of the friendly range', however one of the test conditions asserts this answer: ['March 1st, 2017','May 5th'], which seems to be the opposite.nnOverall, I think more clarity and consistency between the instructions and test conditions is needed to improve this challenge.n

issue.title: Ambiguous question statement in 4 Basic Parts of Computer Basics Hike
issue.body: #### Challenge Namenn[Computer Basics: The 4 Basic Parts of a Computer](https://www.freecodecamp.com/videos/computer-basics-the-4-basic-parts-of-a-computer) (Quiz Question 1)n#### Issue DescriptionnnQuestion 1 of the 'Computer Basics: The 4 Basic Parts of a Computer' quiz (following the reading) asks for a true or false on the following statement: 'The computer has 3 basic parts.' Now simply referencing the quiz title, one can see the unit review 4 basic parts of a computer, but it can be very confusing based on the wording of the question. The answer could be true, as a computer does have 3 basic parts (and one more). The answer could also be false, as many quiz takers expect 4 basic parts by the name of the unit. To make the question clearer, I propose we rephrase the question to be 'The computer has 5 basic parts.'nnMy aim in raising this issue is to make this question more specific, and follow clear logic.n

issue.title: Target the same element with multiple jQuery Selectors
issue.body: This is _by far_ the most frequent question I see in the main chat/receive PMs about. It comes up several times a day. The answers they provide aren't syntax/conceptual issues, it is just that many campers seem to think they are supposed to add all three classes to the last one, #target1. Not sure of the best solution-it's seems straightforward to me- but I think it may be this line that causes the confusion to some of our non-native speakers:nn`Although it is possible to add multiple classes in a single .addClass() call, let's add them to the same element in three different ways.`nnMaybe it is because `although` that is confusing, and stronger emphasis (such as 'We _can_ add multiple classes in a single..... But this time, let's add one class ...') might help? Or something else, heh.nnCheers!n

issue.title: add aditional test for area code
issue.body: Currently on the wiki the second solution `var regex = /^1?s?((d{3})|d{3})?s?-?d{3}-?s?d{4}$/;` also allows phone numbers without an area code.nnI suggest to add an additional test that invalidates thisnn```nexpect(telephoneCheck('555-5555')).to.equal(false);n```nnAlternatively 555-5555 could be added as a valid format in the explanation of this bonfire.n
